title: & nesting selector
summary: The CSS & nesting selector explicitly states the relationship between parent and child rules when using CSS Nesting. It makes nested child rule selectors relative to the parent element. Without the & nesting selector the child rule selector selects child elements. The child rule selectors have the same specificity weight as if they were within :is().
